column6: 3–5 concise bullets stating outcomes, blockers, and key insights; consistent with the work log/evidence.
column9: Summary present and mostly clear, but missing outcomes/blockers/insights and/or includes a few vague or unsupported claims.
column12: Missing/unclear or primarily intentions instead of measurable outcomes.

column2: Sprint work log: quantification and goal linkage
column6: Work items are clearly quantified (e.g., %/done/partial) and tied to sprint goals/commitments.
column9: Progress described and partially quantified; linkage to sprint goals/commitments present but incomplete.
column12: Progress vague and not connected to sprint goals/commitments.

column2: Sprint work log: title, status, and author
column6: Each major work item has a clear title, unambiguous status (%/done/partial), and clear owner/author.
column9: Most items include title/status/owner, but coverage is inconsistent or status is sometimes vague.
column12: Many items missing title/status/owner, or status is unclear.

column2: Sprint work log: reviewers and source link
column6: Each major work item includes a trackable source link (issue/task/PR/requirement/test/ADR/doc) and reviewers/collaborators where applicable.
column9: Many items include links and/or reviewers, but coverage is incomplete or inconsistently formatted.
column12: Few or no links and/or reviewers/collaborators.

column2: Sprint work log: blockers and replans
column6: Blockers documented with concrete replans (what changed, why, and what will be done next).
column9: Blockers mentioned with a basic response.

column2: Sprint work log: supporting artifacts (per-item evidence coverage)
column6: Each work item has at least one verifiable artifact, or one artifact clearly covers multiple items (explicitly stated).
column9: Many items have artifacts, but coverage is incomplete or doesn’t clearly map to listed items.
column12: Few or no items have verifiable artifacts.

column2: Sprint work log: supporting artifacts (relevance and context)
column6: Artifacts are clearly relevant to claims and include brief context (what it shows and why it matters).
column9: Artifacts mostly relevant but context/captions inconsistent.
column12: Artifacts unclear, unlabeled, or not tied to claims.

column2: Sprint work log: supporting artifacts (traceability and version of truth)
column6: Artifacts link to an evaluable source of truth (commit hash for code; stable link + title/date/version/location for write-ups).
column9: Some traceability present, but hashes/links/context incomplete.
column12: Artifacts not traceable (missing hashes/links/context or broken links).

column2: Bug tracking: bug snapshot is current
column6: Includes current open bug count (with link to bug list/query) and prioritized top 3–5 high-impact open bugs; if “No known bugs,” includes link and what was done to check.
column9: Some bug info present, but missing count or top-bug list, and/or not clearly current.

column2: Bug tracking: per-bug details, traceability, and actions
column6: For each top bug: severity/impact, owner, status, and usable link; top 2–3 include concrete next action (who/what/by when).
column9: Most bugs include some details/links, but missing key fields or actions are vague.
column12: Bug list missing key fields and/or few usable links/actions.

column2: Next sprint plan: prioritized and traceable
column6: 3–5 prioritized, measurable next-sprint items, each linked to a verifiable source of truth (issue/task/requirement/test/ADR/doc).
column9: Next-sprint items listed with some prioritization and some links, but specificity/traceability uneven.
column12: Next-sprint plan missing, vague, or lacks links.

column2: Team process reflection: specificity and insight
column6: Specific reflection grounded in what happened; identifies the “why,” not just the “what.”
1–2 concrete, actionable improvements with clear next steps.
column9: Improvements listed but may be vague.

column6: Shows how the team will apply improvements next sprint (who/when/how tracked).
column9: Intends to apply improvements but plan is light.

column6: Concise, well-structured, polished; clear headings and bullets; optional media (if included) is legible and improves readability.
column9: Mostly clear with some structure; minor readability issues.

column6: Professional tone; claims are precise and easy to follow.
column9: Generally clear; occasional ambiguity or awkward wording.

column6: If media is used: legible with alt text and short captions; links are descriptive.
column9: Some accessibility practices used; minor gaps.
column12: Missing alt text/captions when media is present and/or inaccessible formatting.
